attributes.action: Call for a referendum on the production, sale and use of cannabis becoming legal
attributes.background: The rest of the modernised world are liberalising their drug policies towards cannabis, 6.6% of Britons use it annually highlighting the direct mainstream support for the plant and the current % of population forced into the illicit market. Leave the decision to the people through a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: America, Holland & Spain all have established legal frameworks showing how this drug can be safely implemented into society. It is said that the UK cannabis market could bring in £900m through taxes, save £400m on policing the drug & create 10,000+ jobs. It's proven legalisation of the drug reduces harm to individuals & communities through introduction of a regulated market & proper treatment. Our outdated system has discredited the law & empowers criminals, forcing users into the illicit market

attributes.action: Make healthcare insurance exempt from Insurance Premium Tax (IPT)
attributes.background:
The Association of Medical Insurers and Intermediaries (AMII) is calling on people to support this petition for healthcare insurance to be made exempt from IPT in the UK - helping more people protect their health and reducing strain on the NHS

IPT is set to rise to 12% from June 2017.
attributes.additional_details:
This is the third increase in just 19 months.

This means for every £1,000 in premium paid, the government takes £120 in IPT and this could make the difference between someone maintaining health insurance or returning to an overstretched NHS.

Stop penalising people for prioritising their health - make health insurance exempt from IPT.

Sign this petition to help healthcare insurance be part of the solution to the growing health crisis - visit http://amii.org.uk/ipt-petition for more details.

attributes.action: Make the Long Service medal available to officers who retired before July 2014
attributes.background: The new Long Service medal is only available to officers who were serving on 29 July 2014. This is discriminatory against all those who retired before this date.

attributes.action: Make CPR trianing part of the National Curriculum in Secondary Education
attributes.background: My husband suffered a cardiac arrest and without my CPR training would not have survived. He is only here today as I had completed a CPR training course. Only 8-10% of out of hospital cardiac arrest cases survive in the UK as opposed to 25% in Norway where mandatory CPR training is given in schools
attributes.additional_details: In 2014 the Cardiac Arrest consensus in the UK showed that attempted resuscitation's(out of hospital)were approximately 28,000-only 8.6% (2,408) of this number survived. Research suggests if more people were trained in CPR 50% of deaths caused by cardiac arrest could be prevented. The earlier CPR is administered the greater chance a person has of survival - they do not always have the time to wait for first response teams. We desperately need life saving skills taught as standard in our schools.

attributes.action: Reinstate ring fenced funding for Social Care.
attributes.background:
Hospitals full. 15 minutes domiciliary care, Black Alerts isolation and deaths.
Whilst Council ups Council Tax and preen ego's on the backs of frontline staff and Hunt refuses to take the Bullet for his ineptitude.

Reinstate ring fenced funding for Social Care
attributes.additional_details:
We can prevent anymore of this happening.

Just press a button.

PLEASE DON'T BE SILENT ANYMORE. THERE IS NO NEED TO VIA THE INTERNET.

attributes.action: Increase the amount of funding allocated to our police force
attributes.background: West Yorkshire Police are stretched to capacity, more funding urgently needs to be allocated to enable the force to be more effective, match capacity to demand. Currently demand outweighs capacity, officers are under huge pressure facing assaults and huge workloads. More frontline police are needed.

attributes.action: Make people aware of the dangers of Methanol poisoning when travelling & in UK.
attributes.background: Cheznye Emmons died of Methanol poisoning in Indonesia 2013. She drank from a sealed bottle. We want Methanol awareness & support to stop others losing their lives.In 2013 alone,Bali attracted 3.1 million visitors, roughly 720,000 of those from the UK, all in danger of suffering Methanol poisoning.
attributes.additional_details: With more and more people travelling abroad, we feel  travellers are entitled to information that could save their life. With at least 60,000 Brits passing through Bali airport every month, if they drink alcohol they are at a high risk of suffering or dying from Methanol poisoning.

attributes.action: Install an electric vehicle charging point in every town and village in the uk
attributes.background: There are vehicle charging points in London and the South and in towns and cities around Europe. If the government is promoting their use and therefore reduced emissions, it is vital that these are available throughout the UK. Charging points in every conurbation would allow for all electric travel.
attributes.additional_details: My parents, friends and I (and other advocates of the change to all electric vehicles) feel it is a shame that charging points are not available when we travel. We support this initiative but it is made a lot less practical because of the lack of charging points in accessible places. We recognise the government provides grants for their installation, however if every council was made to install them these would be redundant. Grants are about pro activity, laws are about consistency.

attributes.action: Substantially increase funding for the NHS and our Social Care system.
attributes.background: Ask politicians to think again and divert funding from nuclear weapons systems (replacing Trident) to pay for much larger annual increases in funding for the NHS and our Social Care system in order to provide the efficient, properly staffed and well equipped system that we all need and deserve.
attributes.additional_details: It is time for all citizens of the UK and politicians of all parties to face up to the fact that the NHS and Social Care system in all parts of the UK needs substantially greater funding. Replacing Trident is estimated to cost between £100 billion and £200 billion – scrapping the system would allow £5 billion (more than double the current annual increase) to be available every year for the next 20-40 years.

attributes.action: Give all parents adequate support following the sudden death of a child.
attributes.background: Research has found families in Leeds have insufficient support following the sudden death of a child. The bereavement support study, commissioned by Leeds charity Elliot’s Footprint, identified that the current level of support is ineffective, leaving bereaved parents struggling and grieving alone.
attributes.additional_details:
•	Only 16% of professionals in Leeds think that child bereavement support is currently effective
•	100% of the families who had contacted the counselling service found it unsuitable due to long waiting times or lack of child bereavement experience
•	Over 50% of professionals said they did not know who coordinated child bereavement services in Leeds and 45% saw the need for a single organisation to coordinate it

attributes.action: Legalise conjugal visits in UK prisons.
attributes.background: This aims to prompt the introduction of conjugal visits for the 85,998 prisoners in HMPs across the UK. Some will be of the view that prisoners should be granted no privileges, but neglect thought of the spouses who endure great heartache, stress and aloneness whilst their partner is incarcerated.
attributes.additional_details:
Science demonstrates the positive effects that would be seen with regards to reduction of violence and aggrevated incidents within then prison. This is highlighted in hundreds of psychological and scientific case studies.

Not only is a prisoner's own life severely impacted but also their spouses', who have to hold everything together in their partners absence. Spouses did not commit a crime yet bare huge burdens, without the ability to maintain a physical connection with their partner.

attributes.action: Make the ESA assessment more fair for people with M.E./CFS and similar illness.
attributes.background: There are many people in the UK who are being found fit for work when to most people they are obviously not. Many people who find it hard to even look after themselves are being asked to find work, which is leading to despair for them and their families. This over simple assessment needs changing.

attributes.action: Change or ease the rules surrounding 'gardens' on baby graves.
attributes.background: 8 weeks after burying my little boy, who was born asleep in June of this year, we recieved a "rule book" stating what we can and cannot do with his resting place that a paid for. Such rules included not being able to lay stones and not coming away from the headstone by more then 12" etc.
attributes.additional_details:
I know that the rules in baby gardens and what is 'allowed' differs nationally. After being asked recently to remove ALL items from my little boy's grave, I'm petitioning to get the rules at certain cemeteries eased or changed, to allow bereaved parents to decorate their child's resting place as they see fit, providing it remains maintained by the grave 'owner'. 

Buried babies may only be a plot number to some, but they are our children and deserve their own little gardens. 

Thank you.

attributes.action: Cancel the State visit by Trump and use the money to rescue child refugees.
attributes.background:
Amber Rudd has canceled the Dubs scheme, which was designed to rescue child refugees who have made it to Europe, saying that the resources are not available to care for their needs.

Cancel the visit  and use the funds  to settle child refugees in the UK.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to increase flat rate VAT to 16.5%
attributes.background: The Chancellor announced in his Autumn statement flat rate VAT will increase to 16.5% from April 2017. This means for a business such as my own there will typically be an additional 4.5% per year tax on gross turnover. The increase is not justified placing an additional tax only on small businesses.
attributes.additional_details:
The flat rate VAT scheme was introduced to help small businesses simplify VAT reporting by reducing the need to complete a full VAT return and in turn help HMRC by reducing their workload checking full VAT returns.
The proposed change will mean that many businesses will withdraw from the flat rate scheme placing a new and increased burden on HMRC in receiving and managing their full VAT returns. Sadly some small businesses will not survive the imposition of the new tax charge.

attributes.action: Reduce Business rates for small businesses and Sole traders.
attributes.background: Small businesses are in serious threat of being destroyed through ever heightening rent, and furthermore unreasonable, crippling business rates set by the government.  Rates are once again rising as of next year, despite the current economic difficulties for independent businesses.
attributes.additional_details: Remember, charities that occupy commercial properties are exempt from business rates, which increases the demand from small and large businesses alike.  Rates are currently destroying family/small businesses.  Lets get this changed.

attributes.action: The Government should not support any company that leaves the UK post Brexit
attributes.background: I am calling on the Government to require; that all Government bodies and all Government agencies, do not enter into a contract with, or use the services of, any company that plans to move any part of their operation out of the UK, because of its exit from the European Union.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the people of the United Kingdom to unite in threatening to boycott, the services and products of any businesses, that plan to relocate out of the UK, post Brexit.
Did you know that companies including HSBC, EasyJet & Vodafone are considering moving their offices from the UK to Europe? This would risk 1,000's of UK jobs. Help us to put the GREAT back into Great Britain by boycotting these companies & any others that threaten to leave the UK. Show your support #Letstakebackthepower

attributes.action: Provide  benefits, housing, and healthcare for returning expats if Brexit occurs
attributes.background: Retired British citizens who have made their homes in Europe fear for their future well-being when they no longer have the right to stay. Returning to Britain, unable to sell the houses they spent their life savings on,requiring  health care, the government should provide now for that eventuality

attributes.action: Allow unmarried bereaved spouses to be on their child's birth certificate
attributes.background: A woman took her daughter to be registered today! However after an unexpected death of the dad he never knew of her existence and will never meet her and as unmarried bereaved spouses her daughter is not allowed to have her biological father on her birth certificate.
attributes.additional_details: This has always been the case of unmarried bereaved spouses but should this child suffer anymore than she has too?

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of the Zeilsdorf Family from Laggan.
attributes.background: The family are waiting for imminent deportation as they have failed to meet the criteria of their Entrepreneur Visa by employing 2 people in their tiny shop and coffee bothy in Laggan. They do employ 1, they have 3 children, and take care of the local rural community by providing a valuable service.
attributes.additional_details: They are being forced to leave before they can sell. There's every chance that the business will not continue and the area will lose it's shop. Other similar services are tens of miles away. Their children are Scottish, they employ someone, and they make regular visits to local elderly and house bound people in the community as Jason was a Pastor. It is not the Highlands, Scotland or Scottish people who don't want and them; it is just the Home Office. We NEED them - sign  to keep the Zeilsdorfs.

attributes.action: A second EU referendum for all including UK citizens living anywhere in the EU.
attributes.background: I along with about 4 million other UK citizens living in the EU outside the UK and the people of the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man were not consulted in the recent In/Out EU referendum. Also many lies were told by the "Brexit" camp. I understand that Oxford's word of the year is "post-truth".
attributes.additional_details:
I came to work and live in Denmark, thanks to our two countries long association and their being in the EEC (later EU) together.

The recent UK referendum on EU membership did not allow the UK citizens in the EU outside of the UK and the  citizens of the Channel Islands and Isle of Man a vote. This is grossly unfair and undemocratic. It surely renders the recent referendum morally invalid.

attributes.action: Do not wait for an unnecessary consultation and ban letting fees immediately
attributes.background: In the Autumn 2016 statement, the government said they would 'ban letting agents’ fees to tenants' and they would 'consult ahead of bringing forward legislation'. This does not amount to a ban, merely a 'consultation'. This is deceiving, Scotland has banned these fees, so no consultation necessary.
attributes.additional_details:
I do not believe the Government has any intention of following through with this ban. Two months prior to the Autumn statement, Housing Minister Gavin Barwell stated that a fee ban was a "Bad idea". This CONSULTATION was parroted as POLICY IMPLEMENTATION. Five months on and still no timetable has been announced on this 'consultation'. 

Agencies have continued to profit from fees that range from £100 to as high as £700 in some areas (Shelter, 2016). This is disgusting and immoral.

attributes.action: Prevent the Government from widening the scope of combat immunity.
attributes.background: Servicemen and women injured during combat will be shut out of the justice system under new Government plans to widen the scope of combat immunity to stop claims of negligence coming to court.
attributes.additional_details: Under the proposals, combat immunity - which provides an exemption from legal liability for members of the armed forces and the government - would apply to all claims brought by those in combat, even when failings occurred far from the battlefield.

attributes.action: More rail safety to prevent further suicides and accidents by rail
attributes.background: My son Oscar Phillips took his own life aged just 16. With no history or signs of any mental illness, Oscar one day took himself to our local station and never came back.  A lonely station, no staff and 80mph trains passing, yet this is a public area HELP PREVENT SUICIDE & ACCIDENTS.
attributes.additional_details:
To see the full story of how my son died google Oscar Phillips Whitby High School Great Sutton.

We live this horror every day like so many others who have lost loved ones through suicide. It is time to make the changes and protect our future generations.

Please sign our petition.

attributes.action: Melton Mowbray needs a bypass before 4000 homes are built.
attributes.background: Due to the increased congestion in Melton Mowbray, no more houses should be built until Government funding has been secured and a bypass completed.
attributes.additional_details: a Melton bypass is desperately needed.  Sections of a proposed "Distributor Road" will be built by developers but the important section that links the roads together needs Central Government funding.  Without that link they are roads to nowhere.

attributes.action: Appeal Right MUST BE GIVEN to Tier 1 Entrepreneur and Tier 1 General Categories
attributes.background: Home Office on basis of pointless excuses ,self judgment and minor points totally refusing extensions and ILR applicants. Tier 1 Entrepreneur Visa and Tier 1 General Visa holders while applying for ILR are not given Right of Appeal. Throwing applicants many years of efforts and wait in bin.
attributes.additional_details: Applicants have to go through Extremely Expensive, Time-taking, Lengthy, Frustrating Process when they reach ILR stage. Home office not giving right of appeal shows their level of aggression and disconcern  which demotivates and demoralizes genuine applicants.

attributes.action: Police to ask African heritage DV victims if they require specialist support
attributes.background: In 2014 Valerie Forde and baby daughter died as a result of a vicious attack by an ex partner/the child's father. A Domestic Homicide Review report found police made mistakes which may have contributed to their deaths. Research has shown that African heritage people are less likely to report abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Issues undeniably ours such as reduced likelihood of equal treatment, inappropriate reference points, increased likelihood of not being believed or taken seriously, repeated need to explain our cultural norms & language which result in us constantly educating and consoling others before we receive support.  We are petitioning for it to be mandatory that African heritage women are offered the chance to speak to a domestic or sexual abuse specialist from the African heritage community.

attributes.action: Ban umbrella type payment schemes
attributes.background: Umbrella type payments schemes are robbing and depriving workers
attributes.additional_details: I have numerous pieces of evidence to support this petition,also a lengthy list of signatures that would like to see an end to 3rd parties taking money from workers

attributes.action: Due to its defence policy this house has no confidence in the government.
attributes.background:
The first duty of any government is the defence of the realm and its people.  The reports of the Commons Defence Select Committee and of Sir John Parker are ignored.
The Army Reserve is under strength.
In the UN we should be able to “Speak softly and carry a big stick”.
attributes.additional_details:
The Type 45's have not had their defects rectified. Our fleet is not able to defend our trade or undertake our world-wide duties. 
The army is  a militia.  Personnel have despicably been made redundant immediately qualifying for pension.  The RAF has too few A/C and no maritime reconnaissance capability.

attributes.action: To stop the proposed closure of our local post office in Ulverston Cumbria.
attributes.background:
It's listed as one of the proposed closures...Ulverston is a market town and the post office is an essential part of our community.  It provides essential services including banking with lots of them shutting too.
It's centrally located..a central hub and provides employment and we need to keep it.

attributes.action: Remove restriction on travel to Egypt
attributes.background:
Despite the fact that horrific terrorist acts have become endemic Europe, the Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) has not issued restrictions with respect to British citizens travelling to affected countries except Egypt.
Please remove all advice restrictions with regard to travel to Egypt.
attributes.additional_details:
This is despite Egypt vigorously and successfully fighting international terrorist threats. This is unjust and blatantly inconsistent with the pursuit of a pragmatic and impartial foreign policy. 
Egypt is home to a third of the world's historical heritage. It is unfair to deprive British citizens of the countless contributions it has made to civilisation.
Egypt also needs tourism revenue. And also to ensure it remains open to the world and is empowered to overcome the toxic radical ideology.

attributes.action: Reduce the fuel duty rate by 50% on all road fuels.
attributes.background: Our current fuel duty rate is 57.95 pence per litre on petrol, diesel, bio diesel and bioethanol. I believe a 50% relief of fuel duty would boost our economy hugely as well as helping the poorest get to work cheaper so they can earn more
attributes.additional_details:
As of the 1/2/17
Fuel Duty rates
The rate you pay depends on the type of fuel.

Type of fuel	Rate
Petrol, diesel, biodiesel and bioethanol	57.95 pence per litre
Liquefied petroleum gas (LPG)	31.61 pence per kg
Natural gas used as fuel in vehicles, eg biogas	24.70 pence per kg
‘Fuel oil’ burned in a furnace or used for heating	10.70 pence per litre

attributes.action: A Public holiday should be held to celebrate the Queen’s Sapphire Jubilee.
attributes.background: The Queen's record-breaking 65 years on the throne should be marked with a national public holiday in the summer. To mark this historic event a day of celebrations should be held similar to the events that happened in 2012 for the Diamond Jubilee.

attributes.action: For schools to teach children ages 6-15 the mental damage bullying can do.
attributes.background:
Bullying- some school's have excellent policies for it where as some don't.
Bullying is becoming more viral on the internet and social networks.
Although they may get punished somehow for this do they actually realise what they are doing to that person mentally?
attributes.additional_details:
Educating children in schools the effects bullying has on a person's mental health and how it will effect their future.
When you are young you don't realise what you are doing you just think your the cool hard kid wanting everyone's attention, therefor not thinking about what you are doing to that person.
So making it part of a weekly lesson can help children understand that bullying will effect people in later life and also effect their schooling and education.

attributes.action: Persuade laundry appliance manufacturers to install safety sensor to save lives
attributes.background: Research shows many children and pets have died or been injured in laundry machines. This is easily preventable in this day and age if manufacturers would invent and install a safety sensor to detect C02 or a heartbeat which immediately shuts down the machine or emits an alarm
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1297804/Boy-4-dies-tumble-dryer-hide-seek-game-goes-tragically-wrong.html
http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/west_midlands/4446656.stm
https://www.whitegoodshelp.co.uk/children-pets-dying-in-washing-machines-and-tumble-dryers/
http://www.experienceproject.com/stories/Accidentally-Killed-My-Pet/1459836
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22008786
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/boy-3-suffocated-while-trapped-in-tumble-dryer-1237160.html

attributes.action: Ban the use of Chinese Lanterns making it a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Chinese Lanterns cause severe burns, severe injury or possibly the loss of Livestock.  
They could potentially cause damage to property starting fires leading to loss of life.
attributes.additional_details:
A young horse received severe burns to his head, face, eyes and around his ears due to a Chinese Lantern landing in his field last night. Luckily his wounds are superficial and the vet has said he will make a full recovery.  He is not the first animal to be injured and won't be the last unless something is done.  

What happens if a lantern lands on a house with a thatched roof? Devastation and loss of human life! Act now. 



https://www.facebook.com/pgeventing/posts/1787032784885609

attributes.action: Pay Kinship, Private Foster and SGO carers the same as Foster Carers
attributes.background: Private Carers of Children give NO less Love or Affection to their little ones ... The cost of living is the same as is all other cost incurred for raising children. Foster carers receive a decent allowance in respect of their charges ..... Private carers are means tested and not treated as fairly.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence on Theresa May and Boris Johnson over brexit & Trump visit
attributes.background: It has become clear in our opinion that the government are choosing to ignore the will of the people and continue to go ahead and invite president Trump here in the UK on a state visit, When there is a clear opinion that we the majority of the citizens of the UK do not wish him to visit.
attributes.additional_details: This is proven by the clear mandate in the form of a petition that was posted and now has over one million signatures against the visit. The government are also choosing to ignore the will of the citizens in Ireland and Scotland where there was a clear mandate that people wished to remain in the EU by not allowing them have a separate vote in Brexit. We the citizens therefore have no confidence in Theresa May or Boris Johnson and ask them to resign and call for an early general election.

attributes.action: A universal label to show if an item contains an animal product.
attributes.background: Seeing how animal agriculture is one of the leaning causes of environmental damage, we need to be better informed. Many products use made up words to hid what's in them. Animal by products are not only used in the end item but also in the making of it. We should be able to clearly see this.

attributes.action: Drink drivers who kill must be charged  with 'Manslaughter'!
attributes.background: Wayne Moores was twenty eight. He was killed by a 'hit and run' drink driver, who was speeding and illegally undertaking another vehicle. He was left to die in the road.  His killer was charged with ‘Careless Driving whilst under the influence...’ and was out of prison within 3 years.
attributes.additional_details: Drink driving is never 'careless' it is must be considered automatically dangerous. Anything less is weak, offensive and insulting to the memory of those killed. It undervalues their lives by calling this crime a driving offence and is not proprtionate as the government states. Killing someone is not a 'driving offence', it is 'manslaughter'.

attributes.action: Fund ADHD Clinics with resources for Adult diagnosis assessments across the UK.
attributes.background: ADHD previously known as ADD is not just a problem in children. 50% of adult females & males have it. Funding in the UK for adult diagnosis is beyond disgusting,huge waiting lists. GPs need specialist training. ADHD has 3 different types: inattentive type,hyperactive-impulsive type & combined type.
attributes.additional_details: The disorder is known as a chemical imbalance in the management systems of the brain & experts now believe that this disorder has hereditary, psychological & biological factors.The symptoms in adults can be far less obvious, despite their effect, than those in children. ADHD is very difficult in adult life, and, if left unchecked, sufferers could find themselves with a range of difficulties, like financial complications, problems at work, relationship problems & physical or mental health issues.

attributes.action: Automatic custodial sentence if convicted of possessing Cat A child sex images.
attributes.background:
A local man convicted of possessing, creating and distributing 171 child sex images, 33 of which were category A.
He received a community order despite sentencing guidelines for category A images being custodial.
Released back into the same area, 0.3 miles from local schools.
attributes.additional_details:
Sentencing council guidelines for category A images being:-
Possession
Starting point of 1 year custody
Category range  23 weeks to 3 years custody
Distribution
Starting point of 3 years custody
Category range 2 to 5 years custody
Production
Starting point of 6 years custody
Category range 4 to 9 years custody

Hundreds of sex offenders are being given lenient punishments by British judges despite committing “abhorrent” crimes against children.

attributes.action: Oppose the bill to trigger Article 50 in the parliamentary vote.
attributes.background: The ruling that Parliament must vote on whether Brexit is put in motion makes the MPs directly accountable to the people for the most important political decision of a generation. We urge you to listen to the overwhelming expert advice against Brexit and consider what real mandate you have for it.
attributes.additional_details: 73% of 18-24 year olds voted to remain, as did the majority under 45: it is their future you are deciding. The Leave campaign was based on many outright lies, among them promises that we would not leave the single market or the customs union; many Leave voters are showing regret. We remind you of how Labour were made to answer for their decisions on the Iraq war. You, the elected MPs, are the people’s true representatives and the future of the country rests in your hands and on your conscience.

attributes.action: Re-Open hemel hemstead hospital A&E unit.
attributes.background: Since Hemel Hempstead A&E unit closed, Watford A&E unit is struggling to keep up with patients in Hertfordshire.
attributes.additional_details: It became public ,that on our NHS sources, including a statement from Watford general hospital not to attend to A&E unless necessary and Please call 111 first.

attributes.action: Save The “Lollipop” School Crossing Patrol Service And Save Children’s Lives
attributes.background: As a matter of urgency, the School Crossing Patrol service needs to be put under review by government to ascertain how effective it has been in saving children’s lives for the past 70 years. Until a full debate by parliament has occurred there should be an immediate halt to any cut to this service
attributes.additional_details:
School Crossing Patrol Officers or “Lollipop” Ladies and Men need to be recognised for the invaluable service they provide in protecting the nation’s children from injury or fatality. At present the School Crossing Patrol is a non-statutory service; and is therefore under attack from local government budget cuts.
The first duty of government is to keep its citizens safe.  
Children’s lives should be paramount; therefore, the School Crossing Patrol service should become a statutory requirement.

attributes.action: Parliament's kitchen to serve only British food after Article 50 is triggered.
attributes.background: The government have decided that the EU referendum result means leaving the single market and customs union. To show the absurdity of this logic, why not decide that it also means removing EU food from the British diet? The House of Commons can start: no more pasta in parliament.

attributes.action: Fathers should not pay CSA if they don´t have access to their child
attributes.background: Mothers who claim CSA and do not let fathers see their child shouldn't be allowed to do so. A parent can´t have the best of both worlds claiming CSA and deny the other parent access, its not fair and its not right.
attributes.additional_details: I understand some cases are different i.e the other parent is dangerous for the child to stay with. In these cases CSA should still be available.

attributes.action: Sanction trade deals with China, for condoningBarbaric Animal Cruelty
attributes.background: Each year Billions of Animals in China meet with a grisely death. They are beaten and skinned alive and yet Britain is happy to continue trade dealing with a country with such an appaulling animal welfare record. Elephants and Rhinos are nearing extinction because of the illegal ivory trade. STOP!!!
attributes.additional_details: Each year millions of cats and dogs are bludgeoned and skinned alive.http://www.peta.org/features/nine-shocking-fur-facts/  Bad enough that they have terrible suffering whilst alive, then to meet a barbaric death is unethical. The only way China and other country's will take any action to reduce this unscrupulous cruel farming is if they are penalised. By buying goods from these country's, we condone how they do business. I do NOT and I want my Country to act in the name of compassion!

attributes.action: Save Savay Farm and Savay lake from HS2
attributes.background: HS2's proposed Colne Viaduct would destroy Savay Lake and the setting of Savay Farm, a grade 1 listed house of immense historical interest which also has a scheduled monument. We want to preserve these precious sites for future generations to enjoy.
attributes.additional_details: HS2 want to build a massive viaduct (2.25 miles long and as tall as a pylon across the Colne Valley in Denham/Harefield. Savay Farm is a grade 1 listed house of great historical significance; nearly 900 years old; former home of Sir Oswald Mosley. Savay Lake is legendary carp-fishing lake and amongst the top 3 fishing lakes in England. Immensely beautiful it is full of wildlife and amazing fish. We want the Secretary of State for Transport to put a tunnel under the Colne Valley to preserve these sites.

attributes.action: Save ALL of our rural GP surgeries on the Isle of Wight from being closed down.
attributes.background: The Isle of Wight Clinical Commissioning Group [the CCG] has to provide a Strategic Plan. What is of concern is that in today's local press, the Isle of Wight County Press, it states that GP surgeries with fewer than 10,000 patients might face closure, and patients have to go to larger practices.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/news/isle-of-wight-fails-in-bid-to-improve-access-to-gps-57313.aspx
